Community Circle is such an essential part of the school culture at SCA. In the past, we've gathered together on Friday mornings as a school family to share performances, successes, and to recognize scholars who are working hard to shine brightly each day.

There is no doubt that building a sense of community is important now more than ever. Community Circle looked different than it has in the past, but the return to our Friday morning tradition was a wonderful way to start the day! This week, a group of fourth-grade scholars sang the Star-Spangled Banner in tribute to 9/11. Then, sixth-grade scholars performed a beautiful dance to You Raise Me Up. The performances were live-streamed to all of the classrooms in SCA.

We can't wait for the day when we can bring our scholars and our families together in-person for Community Circle. In the meantime, we will gather together virtually and continue this tradition as a school family.
